title: Barcelona Release v0.1.10
body:
Added
 - On Solana, the accounts that were passed into the transactions are listed in the `tx.accounts` builtin. There is also a builtin struct `AccountInfo`
 - A new common subexpression elimination pass was added, thanks to [LucasSte](https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/solang/pull/550)
 - A graphviz dot file can be generated from the ast, using `--emit ast-dot`
 - Many improvements to the solidity parser, and the parser has been spun out in it's own create `solang-parser`.
    
Changed
 - Solang now uses LLVM 13.0, based on the [Solana LLVM tree](https://github.com/solana-labs/llvm-project/)
 - The ast datastructure has been simplified.
 - Many bugfixes across the entire tree.

title: Add tests for msg.sender system call
body: This PR includes tests for the `msg.sender` system call.

title: Enable assembly compatibility on Solang parser
body: This PR updates the Solang-parser to be compatible with inline assembly and does some refactoring.

title: Add missing cast which causes pointer to address not to be loaded
Support abi.encodeCall() syntax (introduced in solc 0.8.12)
body: This is nice syntax from solc-0.8.12 which type-checks the arguments.

title: Do not use deprecated clap features
Change chat to discord
Testcase for issue #666
Hyperledger chat has moved
Permit error keyword to be used as variable name and ensure parser tests are run
Bump dependencies
feat(parser): add support for custom error types
body:
Add
* ErrorDefinition
* ErrorParameter

support in lalrpop and ast types (based on existing EventDef/EventParam), following https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.11/grammar.html#a4.SolidityParser.errorDefinition

title: Fix line comments that end in non-ascii character
body:
The lexer assumed the last character was 1 byte.

Fixes #660

title: Implement solana AccountMeta builtin
body: This should make it possible to use spl-token

title: Fancy colored compiler diagnostics using codespan-reporting
The parser should record all comments
Permit assigment in ternary
Permit assembly keywords in solidity and vice versa
body: This ensures that `switch`, `default`, `case`, and `leave` are permitted in solidity, and that `return` is permitted in assembly.

title: Allow comparisons between bytes32 and 0
Permit larger type to be used as a value
body:
value or balance is uint128 on ewasm and substrate, and uint64 on
solana. Lots of existing solidity code uses uint256, so permit this but
insert checks and warn about it.

Fixes #632 
Replaces #637

title: Fix invalid llvm IR
body:
LLVM permits invalid IR in many cases, which llc or llvm-dis does not permit.

Fixes #641

Make solana testsuite work on testnet

Adds location to solidity pragma directive. Last part to get [flatten PR](https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/pull/774) merged.

Signed -off-by: Roman Krasiuk <rokrassyuk@gmail.com>

Add location to solidity import directive

cc: @mattsse

title: Update test.yml

Fix regressions in ewasm after address type conversion
Improve subscript ast
feat(parser): DocComments grouping & type annotation
body:
Resolves https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/solang/issues/620

---

- [x] Differentiate different doc comment styles: line (`/// @author Alexey`) and block (`/** @author Alexey */`)
- [x] Group multiple block doc comments into one introducing `SingleDocComment` that's contained in `DocComment::Block` enum variant
- [x] Preserve newlines in both line and block doc comments, so it would be possible to restore the original formatting of comments

title: Move to clap 3.0
Provide method for accessing accounts on Solana
Update dependencies
Make solidity parser a standalone crate
body:
This is essentially a followup on #597 and makes the solidity parser a standalone crate (`solang-parser`)

## Changes
* move `src/parser/*` to `solang-parser`, including lalrpop build
* move `src/sema/ast/Diagnostic` related structs to `solang-parser/src/diagnostics/`. This was necessary because the parser's error is the Diagnostic, but has the downside that some `Diagnostic` implementation is now in two places:
  * made `src/sema/ast/Diagnostic::formatted_message` a function that accepts a `&Diagnostic` instead
* rm unused dependencies in solang 
* reexport the parser, so it doesn't break

title: Small fixes
New sema/parser tests
body:
These tests use the graphviz dot functionality to write the entire ast as a dot file, and compare against pre-generated files.

This ensures that the sema produces a stable ast and there are no regressions.

Both Mac and Linux already use a 8MB stack by default.

Signed-off-by: Sean Young <sean@mess.org>

title: Vector to slice pass creates invalid phi nodes
body:
If the vector to slice pass updates one incoming value for a phi node,
but not another we end up with a phi node that is invalid; one entry
is a vector and the other a slice.

This fix does the following.

1. First collect all the set instructions we are going to update.
2. For all phi nodes, check if there are any reaching definitions we
   are not updating.
3. If any reaching definition for the phi node is not updated, then do
   not update any of them.

Signed-off-by: Sean Young <sean@mess.org>

title: Do not link against libffi
body:
libffi is not needed and we shouldn't depend on it.

Signed-off-by: Sean Young <sean@mess.org>
